title: RNLB Queen Victoria
text:
RNLB "Queen Victoria" is an historic <a href="Lifeboat%20%28rescue%29">shore-based lifeboat</a>, built in 1887, operated by the <a href="Royal%20National%20Lifeboat%20Institution">Royal National Lifeboat Institution</a> (RNLI), and now preserved at <a href="The%20Shipwreck%20Centre">The Shipwreck Centre</a>, <a href="Arreton">Arreton</a>, Isle of Wight.
A rowing boat, "Queen Victoria" operated from <a href="Bembridge">Bembridge</a> on the Isle of Wight from 1887 to 1902. It was then purchased by one of its crew, who converted it for use as a houseboat.
In 1989 Martin Woodward, then <a href="coxswain">coxswain</a> of the <a href="Bembridge%20Lifeboat%20Station">Bembridge lifeboat</a>, purchased "Queen Victoria" and, after several years of fundraising, the boat was finally restored in 1998, at the <a href="Classic%20Boat%20Museum">Classic Boat Museum</a>, in <a href="East%20Cowes">East Cowes</a>.
The boat is now under the stewardship of the <a href="Isle%20of%20Wight%20Historic%20Lifeboat%20Trust">Isle of Wight Historic Lifeboat Trust</a>, a <a href="registered%20charity">registered charity</a>, and is seaworthy.
1999 it was taken to the <a href="BBC%20Television%20Centre">BBC Television Centre</a> in London to appear on the <a href="BBC%20television">BBC television</a> programme "<a href="Blue%20Peter">Blue Peter</a>", to mark the RNLI's 175th anniversary.
